metadata.Title: CVE-2017-15365 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
sql/event_data_objects.cc in MariaDB before 10.1.30 and 10.2.x before 10.2.10 and Percona XtraDB Cluster before 5.6.37-26.21-3 and 5.7.x before 5.7.19-29.22-3 allows remote authenticated users with SQL access to bypass intended access restrictions and replicate data definition language (DDL) statements to cluster nodes by leveraging incorrect ordering of DDL replication and ACL checking.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-15365` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libmariadbclient18 - 1:10.1.34-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
libmariadbd18 - 1:10.1.34-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
mariadb-client - 1:10.1.34-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
mariadb-client-10.1 - 1:10.1.34-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
mariadb-client-core-10.1 - 1:10.1.34-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
mariadb-common - 1:10.1.34-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
mariadb-plugin-connect - 1:10.1.34-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
mariadb-plugin-cracklib-password-check - 1:10.1.34-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
mariadb-plugin-gssapi-client - 1:10.1.34-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
mariadb-plugin-gssapi-server - 1:10.1.34-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
mariadb-plugin-mroonga - 1:10.1.34-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
mariadb-plugin-oqgraph - 1:10.1.34-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
mariadb-plugin-spider - 1:10.1.34-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
mariadb-plugin-tokudb - 1:10.1.34-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
mariadb-server - 1:10.1.34-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
mariadb-server-10.1 - 1:10.1.34-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
mariadb-server-core-10.1 - 1:10.1.34-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

notes.Note: leosilva> following debian notes and code check mysql-5.5 is not affected mdeslaur> possibly mariadb specific issue, marking mysql as not-affected for now

criterions.comment: mariadb-10.1 package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:10.1.34-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
